alert.note: Alert for Adjuntas; Jayuya; Lares; Utuado (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 18 at 7:19PM ADT until September 18 at 11:45PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Juan has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Adjuntas County in Puerto Rico... Jayuya County in Puerto Rico... Lares County in Puerto Rico... Utuado County in Puerto Rico... * Until 1045 PM AST. * At 619 PM AST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.2 and 5.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 1 inch per hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of mainstem rivers, including Rio Tanama, Rio Limon and Rio Grande de Arecibo, as well as creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Flooding in Barrio Dominguito and Barrio Esperanza FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
